gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Water Trails within the Susquehanna River Basin: Pennsylvania, 2006

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Polyline shapefile depicting water trails in the Susquehanna River Basin. The Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission defines water trails as recreational corridors between specific locations that can be used for both single day and multipleday trips. They provide safe access to and information about Pennsylvania's waterways while also providing connections to our history, ecology, geology, heritage and wildlife. There are 10 water trails which cover the following 8 rivers: Susquehanna River (lower, middle, & north), West Branch Susquehanna River, Juniata River, Raystown Branch Juniata River, Swatara Creek, Chemung River, Conodoguinet Creek, and Conestoga River.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Dataset developed to fit the needs of the Susquehanna River Basin Commission and is intended for educational display purposes only.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data research, Gil Hirschel, Environmental Outreach Coordinator, SRBC.

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Section Chief, Information Technology and GIS

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Largest Scale to be used when displaying the data- 1:24,000

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Section Chief, Information Technology and GIS

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The spatial extent of the water trails were taken from the Nationl Hydrography Dataset (NHD). The descriptions of the lengths were taken from two sources: (1) PA Fish & Boat Commission, (2) The Chesapeake Bay Gateways Network.
All known water trails in the Susquehanna River Basin.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Gil Hirschel of the SRBC researched and gathered water trail information for the Basin from the PA Fish & Boat Commission and the Chesapeake Bay Gateways Network. These sources provided descriptions on the beginning and ending points for the water trails. The Event Maker tool was used to select the correct lengths from the NHD. The 10 water trails were then saved as a new feature class and then exported as a shapefile.
Water trails descriptions throughout the basin.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Paddling the Chesapeake: Water Trail Map

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: There are no Use Constraints for this metadata document.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: There are no Access Constraints for this metadata document.
